message.content:
To connect an Android phone to a Windows 10 PC, follow these steps:

1. Enable Bluetooth on both devices: To do this on your Android phone, go to Settings > Connections > Bluetooth and toggle it on. On your Windows 10 PC, click the Start button and select Settings (the gear icon); choose Devices; and then pick "Bluetooth & other devices." Toggle the Bluetooth switch to "On."

2. Pair the two devices: Make sure both devices are discoverable by putting them into pairing mode. On your Android device, you should see a list of available Bluetooth connections under Available Devices in its Bluetooth settings menu.

3. In Windows 10's list of available Bluetooth connections, find your phone; it will likely appear as "[Phone's Name]." Click its name and then select "Pair" (or Connect) from the prompt that appearsâ€”once connected successfully, you'll see "Connected" next to it in your PC's list.

4. Send files or other data
